description: Construction of three storey (with habitable accommodation in the roof space), seven bedroom detached dwelling with integral basement; and associated parking and landscaping (following demolition of the existing house)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: Location Plan: 01; Block Plan: 1212 02; Existing Plans: 1212 03; Existing Elevations: 1212 04; Existing Context Elevations: 1212 05 Rev A; Proposed Elevations 1212 33 Rev D; Proposed Ground Floor Plan: 1212 06 Rev D; Proposed First Floor Plan: 1212 07 Rev C; Proposed Loft Plan 1212 08 Rev B; Proposed Basement Plan: 1212 09; Existing and Proposed Sections: 1212 10; Approved Plans: 1212 13; Approved Elevations: 1212 14; Out Building: 1212 15; Design and Access Statement Rev A, dated December 2012, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Prior to commencement of the development, details and/or samples of materials to be used in the external surfaces of the development hereby approved, including those to be used in the ground surfaces, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details approved and maintained as such thereafter.  REASON:  To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings and to ensure that the resulting appearance and construction of the development is of a high standard, in accordance with policies 3.5, 7.4 and 7.4 of the London Plan, policies 1.1, 1.2(f) and 1.2(g) of the Local Development (Core) Strategy 2012, Policies 7.4 and 7B of the Draft Ealing Development Management Plan Document, policies 4.1, 5.5 and 5.9 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 2004: Plan for the and Supplementary Planning Document 4: Residential Extensions. | Details of attenuation measures from external noise and vibration together with associated ventilation for the proposed residential dwelling hereby permitted shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.  The details approved shall be implemented prior to first occupation of the dwelling and thereafter permanently retained, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of future occupiers of the residential properties, in accordance with policy 5.3 of the London Plan and policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 10 (Noise and Vibration). | Notwithstanding what is shown on the approved plans, details of landscaping, planting and boundary enclosures shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of development.  Thereafter, the details shall be implemented strictly in accordance with the details approved prior to first occupation of the dwelling, hereby approved, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Any trees or plants that are severely damaged, become diseased or die within 5 years from the completion of the development hereby approved, shall be immediately replaced with similar species to those approved.  Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the character and appearance of the area and to enhance the biodiversity of the site and adjoining nature reserve, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7.21 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 3.8, 4.1 and 4.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidance'. | A detailed method statement relating to the demolition of the existing house and the excavation and construction of the basement of the development, hereby approved, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced. The statement shall include details of phasing and programming, removal of material from site; construction methods; site management and access; vehicle and machinery specifications and numbers/frequency of vehicles/deliveries. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved method statement or as otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: In the interests of site safety, the amenities of adjoining occupiers and highway safety, in accordance with policy 6.3 of the London Plan (2011) and policies 4.1, 4.11, 9.1 and 9.9 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) | Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A, B, C, D, E and F of Schedule 2, Part 1 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (or any other order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification) no extensions, alterations or other works shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.  Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and the appearance of the area, in accordance with DM DPD (February 2013) Policy 7A and policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004/2007). | Cycle storage for two cycles in accordance with adopted standards shall be provided prior to first occupation of the residential units hereby approved and retained permanently thereafter.  Reason:  To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policy 6.9 of the London Plan and policy 9.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004. | Refuse and recycling storage enclosures shall be provided prior to first occupation of the residential unit hereby approved and retained permanently thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Reason: To secure the necessary provision of refuse storage in the interest of the amenity of future residents of the building and nearby occupiers in accordance with policies 2.10 and 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' 2004 and Supplementary Planning Guidance 4 'Refuse and Recycling'.
